Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: LKM SQL to SQL (JYTHON)
AUTHOR: Oracle
Description: - Loading Knowledge Module - Loads data from any ISO-92 database to any ISO-92 compliant target database. - This module uses a Jython script to read selected data from the database and write the result into the target temporary table which is created dynamically. - When using this module on a journalized source table, the Journaling table is first updated to flag the consumed records and then cleaned from these records at the end of the interface.
Restrictions: - This Knowledge Module is NOT RECOMMENDED when using LARGE VOLUMES. Other specific modules using Bulk utilities (SQL*LOADER, BULK INSERT...) or direct links (DBLINKS, Linked Servers...) are usually more efficient.
Set this option to NO if you wish to retain temporary objects (tables, files and scripts) after integration. Useful for debugging.

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be set by a specific step in a package. No operation here */ <% } else { %> delete from <%=odiRef.getTable("L","JRN_NAME","A")%> where JRN_CONSUMED = '1' <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be set by a specific step in a package - No operation here */ <% } else { %> update <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> set JRN_CONSUMED = '1' where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang from time import clock as now
try: # Source Connection ConSrc = odiRef.getJDBCConnection( "SRC" )
# Target (Destination) Connection ConTrg = odiRef.getJDBCConnection( "DEST" )
# Statement target + metadata stmtTrg = ConTrg.createStatement() readTrg = stmtTrg.executeQuery("""select * from <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%> where 1=2""") metaDataTrg = readTrg.getMetaData() colLst = '' typeColTrg='' bindVar ='' for i in range(metaDataTrg.getColumnCount()): colLst = str(colLst) + str(metaDataTrg.getColumnName(i+1)) + ',' typeColTrg = str(typeColTrg)+ str(metaDataTrg.getColumnType(i+1))+',' colLst=colLst[:-1]
colLst= '<%=odiRef.getColList("", "[CX_COL_NAME]", ", ", "","")%>' nbCol=colLst.count(',') bindVar=','.join('?'*(nbCol+1)) rqteInsert = 'insert into <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%> ('+colLst+') values ('+bindVar+')' psmt = ConTrg.prepareStatement(rqteInsert)
#Test support BatchUpdates on target connexion try: isBatch=ConTrg.getMetaData().supportsBatchUpdates()
except: isBatch=0 batchSize=100
# Statement source + metadata readSrc = ConSrc.createStatement() sqlSrc="""<%for (int i=odiRef.getDataSetMin(); i <= odiRef.getDataSetMax(); i++){%> <%=odiRef.getDataSet(i, "Operator")%> select <%=odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS")%> <%=odiRef.getColList(i, "", "[EXPRESSION]\t[ALIAS_SEP] [CX_COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "")%> from <%=odiRef.getFrom(i)%> where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getFilter(i)%> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter(i)%> <%=odiRef.getJoin(i)%> <%=odiRef.getGrpBy(i)%> <%=odiRef.getHaving(i)%> <%}%>""" readSrc.setFetchSize(100) rqteSrc = readSrc.executeQuery(sqlSrc) metaDataSrc = rqteSrc.getMetaData()
# Set statement nb=None lstPsmt='' nbLine=0 psmt.clearBatch() deb=now() while rqteSrc.next(): resLine='' for nb in range (i+1): colType=metaDataSrc.getColumnType(nb+1) if colType == sql.Types.VARCHAR: #Code 12 resline=rqteSrc.getString(nb+1) psmt.setString(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.CHAR: #Code 1 resline=rqteSrc.getString(nb+1) psmt.setString(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.INTEGER: #Code 4 resline=rqteSrc.getInt(nb+1) if rqteSrc.wasNull(): psmt.setNull(nb+1,sql.Types.INTEGER) else: psmt.setInt(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.NUMERIC: #Code 2 resline=rqteSrc.getBigDecimal(nb+1) if rqteSrc.wasNull(): psmt.setNull(nb+1,sql.Types.NUMERIC) else: psmt.setBigDecimal(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.DECIMAL: #Code 3 resline=rqteSrc.getBigDecimal(nb+1) if rqteSrc.wasNull(): psmt.setNull(nb+1,sql.Types.DECIMAL) else: psmt.setBigDecimal(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.DATE: #Code 91 resline=rqteSrc.getDate(nb+1) psmt.setDate(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.TIME: #Code 92 resline=rqteSrc.getTime(nb+1) psmt.setTime(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.TIMESTAMP: #Code 93 resline=rqteSrc.getTimestamp(nb+1) psmt.setTimestamp(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.BIGINT: #Code -5 resline=rqteSrc.getLong(nb+1) if rqteSrc.wasNull(): psmt.setNull(nb+1,sql.Types.BIGINT) else: psmt.setLong(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.BINARY: #Code -2 resline=rqteSrc.getBytes(nb+1) psmt.setBytes(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.BIT: #Code -7 resline=rqteSrc.getBoolean(nb+1) psmt.setBoolean(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.DOUBLE: #Code 8 resline=rqteSrc.getDouble(nb+1) if rqteSrc.wasNull(): psmt.setNull(nb+1,sql.Types.DOUBLE) else: psmt.setDouble(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.LONGVARBINARY: #Code -4 resline=rqteSrc.getBytes(nb+1) psmt.setBytes(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.LONGVARCHAR: #Code -1 resline= rqteSrc.getString(nb+1) psmt.setString(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.OTHER: #Code 1111 resline=rqteSrc.getObject(nb+1) psmt.setObject(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.REAL: #Code 7 resline=rqteSrc.getFloat(nb+1) if rqteSrc.wasNull(): psmt.setNull(nb+1,sql.Types.REAL) else: psmt.setFloat(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.SMALLINT: #Code 5 resline=rqteSrc.getShort(nb+1) if rqteSrc.wasNull(): psmt.setNull(nb+1,sql.Types.SMALLINT) else: psmt.setShort(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.VARBINARY: #Code -3 resline=rqteSrc.getBytes(nb+1) psmt.setBytes(nb+1,resline) elif colType == sql.Types.TINYINT: #Code -6 resline=rqteSrc.getByte(nb+1) if rqteSrc.wasNull(): psmt.setNull(nb+1,sql.Types.TINYINT) else: psmt.setByte(nb+1,resline)
resline = ''
#BatchUpdate is supported or execute direct Update if (isBatch): psmt.addBatch() if batchSize==nbLine: psmt.executeBatch() nbLine=0 else: psmt.executeUpdate()
nbLine=nbLine+1
if (isBatch): psmt.executeBatch() #ConTrg.commit() finally: ConSrc.close() ConTrg.close() print "OK"
DEMO.LKM SQL to SQL (JYTHON).Drop work table
